clinical_study.brief_title: Validation of Noninvasive Hemoglobin, Comparison of PVI to Standard Methods, and Validation of Clinical Efficacy of ORI
clinical_study.official_title: Validation of a Pulse Oximetry Based Hemoglobin Measurement System. Comparison of Plethysmographic Variability Index to Standard Methods of Guiding Fluid and Transfusion Management in the Critically Ill Adult Patients. Validation of Clinical Efficacy of ORI for Supplemental Oxygen Titration

brief_summary.textblock: Noninvasive pulse oximetry-determined SpHb will be compared to ABG co-oximetry and research lab equipment-determined Hb values, Oxygen Reserve Index (ORI) will be correlated with paO2 via ABG, PVI and acoustic waveform data will be compared to the arterial waveform extracted SVV or PPV values. The study goal is to establish the correlation of Hb values determined by the SpHb system with Hb as measured by other validated devices, use ORI to correlate with paO2 in the moderate hyperoxic regions and correlation of PVI with SVV or PPV values.

primary_outcome.measure: correlation of noninvasive hemoglobin "SpHb" measurement compared with standard hemoglobin blood test
primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 1 year

primary_outcome.measure: correlation of Plethysmographic Variability Index "PVI" measurement compared with pulse pressure variation "PPV" measurement from arterial catheter
primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 1 year

primary_outcome.measure: correlation of Oxygen Reserve Index "ORI" with partial pressure of Oxygen "PaO2" measurement from blood gas analysis
primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 1 year

study_pop.textblock: anemic adult patients who are admitted into the ICU

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Admitted into the ICU
- Aged 18 years or older
- Mechanically ventilated
- Arterial line placed
- Vigileo/Flotrac System being used for guidance of fluid management
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnancy
- Prisoner status
- Extreme hemodynamic instability
- Multiple vasopressors in use with questionable peripheral blood flow
- Lack of appropriate sites for sensor placement
- Patient or patient's legal representative refusal
